content: work more 36 40 sts 25 cut the yarn approx 15cm/6 from 19 decrease row using col c ch3 ch1 the last stitch pull on the loop on sk1 hdc1 into the next double_crochet st ch1 your crochet hook until the end pops sk1 h repeat the section inside the through - you have now secured the stars a further 15 17 times dc1 last stitch into the next double_crochet st skip the chain from the beginning of the row below turn your work 35 39 sts size 4 only 20 decrease row using col d ch3 sk1 hdc1 into the next double_crochet st ch1 sk1 h repeat the section inside the stars a further 17 times dc1 into the 3rd chain from the beginning of the row below turn your work 38 sts 21 decrease row using col d ch3 ch1 sk1 hdc1 into the next double_crochet st ch1 sk1 h repeat the section inside the stars a further 16 times dc1 into the next double_crochet st skip the chain from the beginning of the row below turn your work 37 sts all sizes 22 using col b c d e ch3 ch1 sk1 hdc1 into the next double_crochet st ch1 sk1 h repeat the section inside the stars a further 14 14 15 16 times dc1 into the 3rd chain from the beginning of the row below turn your work 33 33 35 37 sts 22 #woolandthegang eng assembly & finishing now it s time to join your 2 next you will work a single_crochet piece together edging around the armholes and back edges of your piece your stitch count 1 as your pieces were worked in the is given in stages and then in a total round the entire outside is the right at the end side of your piece however the side with the armhole shaping is your starting at the centre of your right underarm side and the other side is armhole and using col a insert your your overarm side lay your pieces crochet hook through the top st of down flat with the right sides of the the 3 chain sts at the beginning of the overarm sides touching so that the last round x and pull through a loop centre back edges line up the last and ch1 then sc1 into this same st row you worked on both pieces then working in the direction of the arrow sc1 into the next chain space thread your sewing needle with a sc1 into the next double_crochet st sc1 into the length of yarn in col c d e a use the next chain space 4sts whip stitch technique to sew the centre back edges together next sc2 into and around the edge st of each row of the armhole until you reach the centre back 34 38 42 46 sts next from the centre back continue to sc2 into and around the edge st of each row of the left armhole until you
